sentence.text: Subtherapeutic serum quetiapine concentrations after absorption inhibition by binding resins: a case report.
Polystyrene sulfonate and sevelamer are binding resins that are used in the treatment of, respectively, hyperkalemia and hyperphosphatemia
It is unknown whether these resins interact with the antipsychotic quetiapine
We report on a woman with unexplainable low serum quetiapine concentrations who also used the binding resins polystyrene sulfonate and sevelamer
An In vitro binding assay showed binding of quetiapine by these resins
Separation of the ingestion times of quetiapine and the binding resins resulted in increased serum levels in this patient
Polystyrene sulfonate and sevelamer are able to bind quetiapine
Healthcare professionals should be aware of this potential drug-drug interaction as this could lead to antipsychotic treatment failure
